Bills Expected to Decline Offer Sheet
As Brad Biggs of the Chicago Tribune reported, the Bills could be hard-pressed to match the Bears’ offer for Bates.
The Bills tendered the lineman at the lowest level, meaning Chicago will not have to send a draft pick to Buffalo if he ends up signing there.
A front-loaded deal would also be very difficult for the Bills to match, as they are currently tight against the salary cap.
The Bills have already made some offensive line upgrades of their own, landing veteran guard Rodger Saffold in free agency.
“It’s a projection by the Bears as Bates has only four career regular-season and two postseason starts,” Biggs wrote.
